All rights are reserved©2023 Cancel Previous LoginActivity Save your favorites, plan your trip Username Don\'t have account? Click here to Register. OR Register here Confirm Password Sign out The Mardi Himal trek is a challenging and beautiful 4-day route in the Annapurna region that offers breathtaking views of the Himalayan mountain range. It’s a lesser-known route compared to the famous Everest Base Camp trek or Annapurna Circuit trek. Popular adventure Popular destination to visit Plan my trip Paragliding Rafting Bungee Profile Description Itinerary Mardi Himal View Map
Incorrect password Please enter a username Please enter a password Incorrect username
User Profile Setting About us Trip Histrory Mardi Himal Trek Itinerary Day 1:\nPokhara to Kande Kande to Pittam Deurali Day 2:\nPittam Deurali to Low Camp Day 3:\nLow Camp to High Camp Day 4:\nHigh Camp to Base Camp and Base Camp to Low Camp Day 5:\nLow Camp to Sidhing to Pokhara(by jeep) Trek Itinerary Map NAME EMAIL Email address Accommodation included:\nLodge On the way: Hotel Teahouse Accommodation include:\nHotel Accommodation include:\nGuest House Sidhing To Pokhara Where does the trek start? The Mardi Himal trek starts in Kande and finishes in Siding. It’s the standard route to Mardi Himal, trekkers who come from Pokhara or Kathmandu usually do it this way. When is the best time for trekking? April and October are considered to be the peak hiking season when you get the best weather conditions as a result all trekking routes are very busy. We always try to hike in border season; March or November. There are significantly fewer people but sometimes you can be quite unlucky with the weather. Are You Planning A Trip? AIzaSyBPbCWKYJpMtFZ9xC-r8vj_KFTXeabap74 AIzaSyD578hsDRR1WGZaO6Rm1WBaVFSanBOqYQI Log in as admin add image Description + detailed itinerary add day delete add to Day 1 Dashboard Add place Trip message Select a Season Spring Confirm Winter Summer Autumn Annapurna Base Camp The Annapurna Base Camp is a popular trekking route in the mountains of Nepal.The route to Annapurna base camp passes through various villages and viewpoints such as Australian Camp, Sinwa, Ghandruk, Landruk and Deurali.There are other routes to visit the Annapurna Base Camp as well.
Day 1: Kathmandu to Pokhara (By flight or Bus) Day 2: Drive to Nayapul and trek to Ulleri Day 3: Trek to Ghorepani Day 4: Early trek to Poon Hill for Sunrise, Back to Ghorepani and Trek to Tadapani Day 5: Tadapani to Chomrong Day 6: Chomrong to Dobhan (Dovan) Day 7: Dovan to Deurali Day 8: Deurali to Machhapuchhre Base Camp (MBC) Day 9: MBC to Annapurna Base Camp Day 10: Trek to Bamboo Day 11: Trek to Jhinudanda (Hot spring in Jhinudanda) Day 12: Jhinu Danda to Pothana/Jhinu Danda to Ghandruk Day 13: Pothana to Phedi and drive to Pokhara/ Ghandruk to Nayapul and drive to Pokhara
